column4: i want to delete a broken application i install by hand but sudo apt-get remove dont do it
Package manager won't know about it since you installed it by hand.
If you still got the source left, go to the source directory, and do `sudo make uninstall`.
put it in the trach can
If it's still in the trash can, you can restore it from there.
Fetch, as in download where you got it in the first place.
do you think if i do the installation again will over write it?
Then you just need to `./configure && sudo make uninstall`
Ok. And in the future, please use checkinstall for manual installations.
That way the package manager can keep track of files that are being sprinkled across the filesystem.
